bernardsirius wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm currently trying to evaluate heritrix for a small project. I have
> successfully installed and started the server, but I don't understand
> where to go from here.
> 
> You will find my instance of an heritrix server at:
> http://67.207.136.21:8080/ (password: admin)
> 
> I don't find any documentation on this (seems like the documentation I
> have is about something totally different). 
> 
> Anyway, I'd like very much to give a try at launching a crawl job and
> I'd be very grateful for any help you could provide me about this.

You're using Heritrix 2.0; the best guide to getting started with it is 
in the wiki here:

  http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/2.0+Tutorial

There is more information about Heritrix 1.X in the form of the user 
manaul; while the launching and UI have changed, most of the information 
is still useful:

  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/index.html

I would advise against giving out your admin UI password in public, or 
even opening your admin port to all incoming traffic, if you can help 
it. A discussion of the security issues involved is here:

  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/install.html#security

Essentially, you've given everyone on the list the power to change or 
execute anything on your crawler machine that the account running the 
crawler java process could do. I think we're all nice people, but 
wouldn't take that risk myself.

- Gordon @ IA
